title: Finding a check in Chrome
content:
Chrome doesn't allow switching on extensions which are not from the Chrome store. There is no this limitation in Chromium. So it is only in Chrome. It checks 
verified_contents.json
(in which content hashes) and existence of the 
update_url
parameter in the manifest. How to find this check and fix this? I am interested in solving this with debugging. Please help.

comments.text: support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7532015 & developer.chrome.com/docs/extensions/mv3/external_extensions ... but I don't quite see what this has to do with reverse engineering, given it's a setting.
@0xC0000022L It works only for the store extensions. I am interested in solving this with reverse engineering, that is why I ask here.
